website_summaries.verdict: Homes with lots of devices will benefit from the Linksys EA8500's speedy Wi-Fi and storage performance, but those with modest needs should look for something cheaper.
pros: The Linksys EA8500 delivers excellent 5GHz Wi-Fi performance, especially in a network of mixed clients
Its network storage speed surpasses even some high-end NAS servers
cons: The router is pricey and its Wi-Fi performance on the 2.4GHz band is below average
The storage feature doesn't support Time Machine backup

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Report's #1
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a week now. Went from 20 mbps to over 60 mbps. Have over 20 devices connected included Nest Thermostat, Cameras, Protects, Wemo Switches & Lights, Rachio Sprinkler, Vizio TV's. This thing is a beast and the software to setup the network is very user friendly. Would highly recommend if you're looking up upgrade your speed and range. Range in my basement has increased greatly. Chose this router after seeing it ranked #1 on Consumer Reports. It's large in size, so make sure you have room.
customer_reviews.author: TyrannosaurusDunx

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last...
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great, for about a year and a half. Then, it lost signal strength and the Wi-Fi started intermittently connecting to our devices. I contacted Linksys support and they were happy to help me "optimize" the settings (which doesn't address the basic functionality problem). They were also happy to help me troubleshoot, for a price; $30 for one incident or $40 for 6 months of support. Maybe all router brands are the same, but I can't bring myself to buy another Linksys after paying over $150 for his unit that lasted less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and greater than expected results
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to replace the built in router in our Comcast modem. We are finally achieving our promised speeds wirelessly. Even with several devices throughout the house linked in to this unit, we are still getting great speeds. Additionally, I'm getting better coverage throughout our house. The basement, the far corners of the 2nd floor, and even the garage are no longer slow or dead spots.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Caprice

customer_reviews.title: LAN dies after firmware upgrade to version 1.1.8.185832
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I have had to replace this router twice. I am professional in the industry and have installed this router with another customer and they experienced the same issue, where the LAN dies. This usually happens after a firmware upgrade. Calling linksys has been very painful. As usual they put you thru a lot of questions, verification, etc. After 58 minutes of grueling questions they agreed to replace it and tried to transfer me to customer service. Guest what? Customer service was not available so they asked me to call back later. @%#%$
customer_reviews.author: M. Egas

customer_reviews.title: It’ll work, but buy something better
customer_reviews.text: I like the phone app and the control over the device. We’ve had this router for 2 years, and it did well for the first 12 months or so. After that, several of our WiFi devices suddenly stop working every 1-2 days. Each time it happens, we reset the router, and they’re back up and running like normal. It’s very frustrating to have to restart the router every 1-2 days. I’ll be buying another one in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Setup was simple.
customer_reviews.text: Starting point was Consumer Reports ratings. This was the 2nd highest rated in their tests. Setup was simple. WiFi signal strength and coverage throughout the house was noticeably improved. The user interface for the system tools and router settings is useful.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Oleary

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for about 7 months now. I live in a 2800+ house and there are NO weak spots. I have 5 devices connected wirelessly and 6 wired connection on a regular basis. The last router I had, I had to have extenders due to weak spots. I've installed the app on my ipad, which allows me administer the router. I am able to reboot the router from the app, instead to manually unplugging the router and re-plugging it back in like the old router. The old issue that I have come across is that the guest must re-enter their password each 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Swede

customer_reviews.title: Best WiFi I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've used probably 20 WiFi routers and access points over the years and all of them were flaky, requiring reboots, occasionally. Not this one. I use an external hard-wired router, so I am only using the AC2600 for the WiFi. Range at 2.4GHz is excellent, reaching across my whole house. The 5GHz is faster, but range is much shorter - out past one or two walls and the 5GHz side is getting weak and therefore slower than the 2.4G channels. I do not use NAT or DHCP on this, so maybe that contributes to my excellent experience here.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Router
customer_reviews.text: I use this router for home wifi. I run 5 devices with this and all work well. I like the MIMO feature which is great for my 4K LG TV. I had one settings issue and Linksys support was super in correcting the problem over the phone. The issue was not caused by the router but the ISP modem. I also bought the next model Linksys router up the line and it works perfectly like my EA8500. Both have great distance and coverage.
customer_reviews.author: jlines

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Arrived, and worked for 20 minutes. And now I have the hassle of sending it back. And if I want to re order a new one, the price went up. Only ever had Linksys routers. Thinking it is time to research other brands. Just glad the old router is still on its last legs.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: Great router upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a new home and the previous router wasn't reaching its farthest extremities well. We upgraded to this router and it has significantly improved reception throughout the house. We stream with it to Fire TVs that are ~25 ft away with great quality video. It is not a cheap router, but has proven to be worth the price for us.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It's what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Functioning as it should. Easily managed via the phone app, so set that up first then add your other devices. Your phone can just approve them without much hassle. Do occasionally give it a reboot and update the firmware/software as it becomes available. The range easily covers my single-level quarter-acre lot with a strong signal and good speed from a central location within the house.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Good range, lots of dropped wifi
customer_reviews.text: This router has pretty good range and allows lots of devices. However, I have had many issues with dropped wifi connections. Sometimes I can no longer log back into the wifi on certain devices so I have to end up resetting the wifi. After tons of research, I was able to fix that issue of not logging back into the internet, but still have moments where my connection is dropped for a short period.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely works great
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot reviews for this product and those who post negative thoughts may not understand all the DO's & DONT's with the updated models. I have found this product in fact, absolutely does what it's supposed to. I had to go after my (legal criminals) cable company and piss off some people due to the fact they are holding back on UP/DOWNLOAD speeds that help this router shine. I have more than 12 devices connected at any given time and still have never had issues others have reported. Before you knock it check your speeds, this router told on the cable company by revealing that I was not getting what they "sold" me.
customer_reviews.author: JasonVM

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2.2 years, warranty is for 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Router started to make a buzzy sound, died. Maybe a capacitor on the mother board failing? It started as an intermittent problem (WiFi would come and go), then finally went completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Devanney

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for a large home.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, We now have a router which blankets the entire house. All areas of the 4,500 SF house have service now. So thankful to have this up and running. When the entire family is there everyone has WIFI now. Good simple to set up mega coverage produce.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Separate bands work well.
customer_reviews.text: This router got a high rating by Consumer Reports, and I am happy with it now after several months. I was not able to get the specially separated guest network running, but I don't really need a guest network, so I didn't spend the time to figure it out. I just use the 5 GHz band myself, and have the 2.4 GHz band set up for my guests.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Furber

customer_reviews.title: Failing after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Need to reboot daily after lost connection. Sometimes several times per day. Worked great when first installed. Gradually lost connection on distance. Had cheaper routers in the past that worked better. Looking for better router now. I believe they have built in failure so you need to buy a new unit. Good luck if you have this router. Would not buy this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gundy

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck. Solid operation right out of the box. I may buy another just to have as a backup because I am so pleased with this router. I have a metal mesh that holds the plaster to my walls. It's like the NSA in terms of shielding in my home and this device has a strong signal and works better than any other router I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Retirednlovingit

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few days too long to get return or get the $ back hoping I could get this unit to work better. It constantly loses connection. Consumer Reports had this as their top pick but it is junk! Guess I am going back to my old one which was far better than this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I ordered another brand to start and struggled through the setup process and could never get it to work. I sent that back and ordered this -- the Linksis AC2600. Minutes after it arrived, I had it plugged in and followed the (easy to follow) setup instructions. It worked great out of the box, and was super easy to customize the name/password and all of that stuff. Then -- blazingly fast wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this router
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this router. My old router was a linksys which was 25 years old. It was works. However, my need for wireless devices grew and the router just couldn't handle the growth. I have not had one iota problem with this router. I have not taken the time to look at everything it is capable of because I had to get it working as soon as it was delivered. I hope to make some time soon to understand what this router is capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: This router has been a little workhorse. For the first year it was in an outside compartment in our motorhome and it worked very well. This last year we have had it in our house and we have connected quite a few additional components. I had an issue with several connections being bumped off occasionally and technical support was able to walk me through making a few changes to settings that has fixed the problem. I’m impressed with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Anne Baker

customer_reviews.title: Unlucky for me only
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was a used product and its really not end of the world. I have been recommended by many people about this model of linksys router. But upon opening the box and setting up antenna.. i realized where my money went. The connector for all 4 antennas are so loose that its useless to point them any certain way of room., coupled with the sudden outage of wifi signals .. made me to pack this and store in my drwyer. So i am back to point of using my previous router. Note that i got full trust on linksys routers. I think this was just a damaged item i got.
customer_reviews.author: Fahim Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great improvement on any router I have had before
customer_reviews.text: this replaced an Asus RT-N56U that could not stream to any of my Samsung tablets without delay problems. This streams without any problems. The "smart wifi" app is a real help. It shows what is on the network (hardware I didn't think about), lets you prioritize, lets you turn on/off guest, etc.Overall a great improvement on any router I have had before.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Urban

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: After using this router for 4 months, I can't recommend this router. Frequent loss of wifi, connection drops, and regular restarts to get it working is unacceptable for such an expensive router or any router. Firmware updates only seem to make things worse. Definitely look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Olivares

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Comcast hardware - vastly improved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a Linksys DOCSIS 3.0 16x4 to replace my Comcast router. My external bandwidth to the internet is unchanged, but my internal network performance and routing functionality is improved. This also saves me $10/month so should pay for itself in 2 years. Seems significantly more reliable than the comcast router - i.e. I have to reboot it significantly less frequently than the Comcast router.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Wooster

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: We had an old Linksys router and it finally died so we bought this as a replacement and boy were we happy we did! I work from home doing data entry and when my boyfriend comes home he streams youtube or netflix. The streaming is super fast and I never have connection issues. If you are looking for a great router this is the one. I also researched routers before hand and this one had a really high rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jen01234

customer_reviews.title: Great router for new or old router replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for older "n" type routers. Handles more attachments at faster speeds with no drops. Installation was easy and no disc needed, nice App allows you to access the router from smartphone and tablets. Currently have 12+ devices attached, covers whole house without extenders.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Man

customer_reviews.title: Good...for a while
customer_reviews.text: Well, after 18 months of decent (but not stellar) performance, the 2.4 GHz band has simply stopped working. I guess I'll find out how good the warranty is now. I had to order this item twice (the first unit I received was defective), and this one only survived for 18 months? For this price, I expected much better.
customer_reviews.author: MJT

customer_reviews.title: Great signal strength, minimal latency, good inferface but very confusing "apps".
customer_reviews.text: Great range and signal strength. I live in a narrow but long house. It's able to penetrate three walls to include the garage door to the front yard while I'm mowing the lawn and allow my phone to stream music without any buffering. I also have gamed with this through several walls with no latency issues. As far as interconnectivity between user devices goes, it's amazing. I've had over 8 devices ranging from a first gen IPAD, desktop gaming pc, and new android phone connected with no issues. The only thing I have a problem with was their apps to control services other than basic connection activities. All of their add-on services are glitchy and lacking simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: A very solid product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: +Set up is easy breezy+Can handle all my devices in the household without any issues+Gigabit port is fast+you can turn off the LED indicators. Cons: -Annoying Linksys LED-The wireless range is below average-The antennas are a little loose and fall down at times Things I would change about this product. I would improve on the wireless range. Update: After a firmware update, resetting the router to factory defaults and reconfiguring the router the signal strength slightly improved. I still recommend a WiFi extender but this depends on your home.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Alvarez Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great price/performance.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this high performance router. It delivers speed to every square inch of our home. I shopped hard, looking at several name brand AC duel band routers. This one seemed to optimize price, performance and reach the best. Thanks to Amazon I didn't pay near list price. I've been using it for about 5 months. Not one reboot has been required in all that time. The app is great at identifying and assigning antennas to devices.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zarovsky

customer_reviews.title: SOOOOOO WORTH THE PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16 year old who plays computer games online and downloads/uploads all of the time. I have an entire home security system with 2 live cams hooked up to this, 3 more computers, a printer, phones, ipads, as well as a 6TB Cloud internet server. In addition to all of this we stream movies constantly so when I bought this a few weeks ago and really had NO idea what a difference it would make. I LOVE THIS ROUTER!!!! Sooooo easy to install and finally I'm able to utilize as well as maximize the full potential of all of my devices! The speed of everything is absolutely AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Chaindrivr

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after two years
customer_reviews.text: This product is not very good, the reliability is awful and drops signals all the time after only two years.
customer_reviews.author: Jared R

customer_reviews.title: Recomended for Big Families
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router! Would recommend this for anyone that has a big family, specially when they are more than 4 persons streaming Ultra HD netflix, more than 8 cellphones and people gaming on a ps4 or any other gaming device running at the same time! And I just have 15 Megabits! The Only thing I didn't like was that at first I choose automatic setup, and that setup my password automatically so I didn't knew my admin password until I restarted it and start again.
customer_reviews.author: EDUARDO PRADO

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I am not a tech savvy person. I hated my old router and wanted something that worked. This was a consumer report recommended buy. I LOVE IT! Easy to install. I haven't have any problems with streaming movies, or internet on my phone, or my printer. I'm so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: My router didn't automatically "plug & play" when I connected it, so I had to call the Linksys Customer Service number for help. I got through immediately, the representative I spoke with was fantastic and she walked me through getting all of my devices reconnected. The new router is so much better than the older version that we've had for years--various dead spots in the house now seem to be gone.
customer_reviews.author: Cia H.

customer_reviews.title: This wireless router gives me great wireless service thoughout the house
customer_reviews.text: This wireless router gives me great wireless service thoughout the house. I was able to take my Echo to an outside patio at least 50 feet from the router and was able to listen to it. I even think it has increased the speed of my internet surfing. I definitely feel more secure using the router.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Beware of "out of warranty" serial numbers
customer_reviews.text: Router works fine, but I had to jump through many hoops before I was allowed to talk freely with Linksys Tech Support (who was excellent). The reason for the hassle? The serial number on my brand new router was (according to Linksys records) old and "out of warranty." This for a router that I had just ordered and received from Amazon. After proving that this router was recently ordered, I was permitted to speak with tech support to resolve a minor installation issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 4 mos then suddenly started sporadically dropping connections to all devices on both networks (2.4 & 5G). Changed the channels used to adjust for possible saturated frequencies. Updated firmware. Reset to factory default settings and still experiencing the same problems. I work in the IT field and for the price of this router it should be setup once and never have to be touched again. Don't buy. You won't get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Update your router!
customer_reviews.text: Updating my router was a great choice. Had to restart wifi/modem a lot, because it kept losing connection. I think the older model must have had trouble handling multiple devices. Haven't had to restart since I got it. Also, was very easy to setup...especially if you keep the name and password the same.
customer_reviews.author: TexasTea

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: So far it is great, but I have only had it running for a few days. Easy to set up although the setup told me it failed it is working fine with all my devices. My last Linksys worked fine for several years. Replaced it with a more capable and newer version from the same manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: SLK

customer_reviews.title: Not good BUT bad!
customer_reviews.text: It was a used one but was supposedly in good condition. Huh! It looked like it had been dragged behind a car. The connector to the antenna was lose and had to be tightened. To top it all off it is not compatible with the Xfinity/ Comcast system! Also no instruction manual was enclosed. Very poor!
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: This is very powerful and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is very powerful and very easy to use. I was able to setup both 2.4 & 5ghz channels easily, and it works like a charm. Wifi does not just fail on me like a previous router. I do wish the 5ghz band had a further range, but I get great 2.4 coverage all throughout my home inside and around the yard! Can setup Guest access too with separate passwords which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one the same time my father had and both of us have been having the same problems. Constantly dropping signal, buffering and having to cycle the power constantly to reboot.Linksys sent me a replacement and the replacement is doing the same thing. That would be three routers that I know of with the same problems. I would go with a different router!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice router nice price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever!!! This router hands down just rocks. Pings, speed test all Rock solid. The bad. I hate the stupid smart WiFi user interface. It flat freaking sucks. Says AC not supported which it is. All kinds of issues. Router great smart WiFi software sucks!!!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: 2 of these units failed within 8 months. I'm dealing with Linksys directly to get a replacement and they have the WORST customer service I ever experienced. I recommend going to Best Buy and buying the extended warrantee that way you're going to a store front not dealing with off shore in-trained rude customer service reps. what a huge waste of time Linksys!!
customer_reviews.author: James Moody

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROUTER I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to set up - needed to first plug into my old wireless router for it to get connected - then after running through setup, was able to switch directly to connecting to my high speed Time Warner Cable Modem. This is better than the higher numbered models from Linksys due to the "Mu-Mimo" tech - it's the newest future for Wifi, and so far it works amazingly streaming numerous HD video streams concurrently without hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: KingGraham

customer_reviews.title: good coverage and reliable
customer_reviews.text: very user friendly step by step installation good coverage of up to 90 feet have 6 devices connected and working flawlessly . this is my 3rd Linksys router and never was let down Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: VITANGELO D.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best router period
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a lot of routers for my AT&T fiber and they all slowed down the speed except for this one. This is the best router period! Don't look at anything else and just buy this one. I'm a software engineer that works from home and I need 400 MPS and this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Router works with great wireless. The biggest disappointment in the world is ...
customer_reviews.text: Router works with great wireless. The biggest disappointment in the world is the parental controls consentalnty fail. I have all my kids devices set on schedules as well as certain websites blocked only to find that it peridoclly just stops managing the rules. Routers firmware is up to date and functionality can return with rebooting the router but who wants to do that every couple days or potentially allow your kids to run across things that they aren’t supposed too.
customer_reviews.author: James Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Did a fair amount of research and based on consumers reports, made the purchase. Replaced this from my AirPort Extreme. I needed more range and did not get it. My camera would drop connection several times a day. Speed seemed comparable. Set up an account and you can see in a clean network map, iPhone app or online. All in all, not worth the extra cost and I returned it and reinstalled my Apple.
customer_reviews.author: SEAN A PARSONS

customer_reviews.title: Regret purchasing
customer_reviews.text: This router is garbage!!!! DO NOT PURCHASE! It worked for 1 week, then started dropping the wifi. It drops at least every other day. Sometimes it doesn't emit wifi at all. Of course to call tech support will cost. I REGRET buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Fast and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, very powerful. Instead of SmartWifi setup, I went for manual config. We tested and hooked multiple devices at the same time on both floors. Speed: Ethernet ~113mbps speed and WiFi ~78mbps to 60mbps throughout my house (3200 sq ft). I had two extenders initially which I unplugged and don't require them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Thought i was buying new, was not listed anywhere that it was used or refurbished. Wouldnt have purchased it had i known. It does work, but i feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Linksys rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent WIFI signal in a big house, 3 floors with multiple children! Great tech support when my cable modem went out and I need to revonfigure my Linksys router! I’m ecstatic!
customer_reviews.author: Bob I

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE WIFI COMPLAINTS....Get this one.
customer_reviews.text: Do your kids complain about the quality of your wifi? Mine did, until I bought this router, along with the Linksys AC1900 Gigabit Range Extender. They work incredibly together. Our house is large, over 3000 SF and i get signal WAY back in my yard. No more complaining and rarely do i have to reset anything. Excellent products.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Cherevko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!! if you have more than 4 devices ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!! if you have more than 4 devices need one of this to share the internet access and networks, just need connect and some easy steps for configuration and ready to use, maybe need choice a good place for increase the area of signal around the house but was a very good upgrade, now the 4 tablets ,4 smart phone and 3 lat-top has been working fine to see video, navigation, email, MU-MIMO technologies work on this device.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Fast for multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: The AC2600 replaced a router that was much less effective in my home, but even the 2600 would not take care of the entire house (5000+ sq ft). I think it may have except for the fact of radiant heating in the floors creating a barrier. A second router on an upper level was required.
customer_reviews.author: Togasurfer

customer_reviews.title: DEAD
customer_reviews.text: Quit working 3 months after installation. Tried rebooting multiple times. Now I have a Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: wirebend

customer_reviews.title: 10x faster than my old comcast router/modem combo
customer_reviews.text: 10x faster than my old comcast router/modem combo. Totally worth it, plus the range on this thing is outstanding! I can go to the neighbors house and still use my home wifi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Secret Agent Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great range!
customer_reviews.text: This router solved poor reception problems for us. We'd previously been using a Linksys WRT54G (very old), and found that if we were two rooms away mobile phones could not reliably connect to the wi-fi network. The phones reported a 1-5 Mpbs wi-fi link, and anything requiring a connection was flaky. We'd frequently disable the wi-fi because 3G was more reliable and faster. After upgrading to this router, the phones connect to the wi-fi reliably, from anywhere in the house. My phone reports a 292 Mpbs connection, in a spot where it used to have no wi-fi signal at all. Setting up the router was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Setup was fairly easy, and it has been working very well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an upgrade from an old Wrt54g. Setup was fairly easy, and it has been working very well. It is feature rich, and I especially like the option to connect external storage, so I can move files between devices wirelessly. I've never been able to get ftp working between my linux boxes, (my ignorance, not an OS issue), so this is a great work around for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer, Beware
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this thing. I've had it for about six months. It shuts down unexpectedly every few weeks. Tonight, it shut down and isn't recycling. It seemed like a great deal. Now, I know why.
customer_reviews.author: K. Joshua Koch

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS IF YOU PLAN TO USE WIRELESS MORE THAN ONE MONTH!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router towards the end of May. I've barely used it ONE month and now the wireless portion of the router no longer works...which seems to be a VERY common problem. To be clear the Ethernet connections still work and I can use the internet through them but every wireless device can no longer see the router when they were working ok for a month. I have recently upgraded to the latest firmware, did a factory reset of all the settings but wireless is no where to be found. I'm going to try their tech support but can almost guarantee they will have me ship back this POS not ready for prime-time testing box.
customer_reviews.author: Rykion Prangh

customer_reviews.title: Dies right after the warranty does.
customer_reviews.text: 12 month warranty. 18 month actual lifespan. 254 dollars down the drain. Google Linksys AC2600 radio failure, apparently VERY common.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Terrible router. I don’t even get 80% of my download speed. The range is terrible with dropping a lot. Amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Meaad Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Wifi Distribution to all Devices
customer_reviews.text: It has worked really good so far. 10/10. Whenever I play xbox there are no game glitches at all, everything runs super smooth now! I highly recommend this product if your trying to improve the speed in all devices throughout the house. Best thing is that your can even set priority to certain devices.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Total rip off!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. It only lasted a couple of months and then it stopped. This is a total RIP off, just as many of the reviews have said. Will I threw that money away. Do not purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lon Boysen

customer_reviews.title: Works well, poor UI
customer_reviews.text: Got this a few days ago and it's working great. Minus one star, only because the setup UI is irritatingly slow. But I may put DD-WRT on here, replacing that entirely and removing that issue. DD-WRT support would grant this 4.5 stars if I could give it another half.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get Your GIFs Even Faster!
customer_reviews.text: My landlord has a crappy Verizon router that does not have a good range. I ran a CAT-6 cable from his router to mine and am getting faster speeds from my router than I ever did from his. I like the setup and settings utility, makes changing things a breeze. 5/5 would wifi it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Don't blame the router
customer_reviews.text: I had the same frustrations other users reported, having to reboot often, dropped signals, and disconnects. After three calls to Linksys support I was advised to try a Linksys WUSB6300 USB wireless adapter. As soon as I installed it, all problems disappeared. It reaches all parts of our two story 2,800 sq. ft. home and has worked flawlessly the past four months. If you computer is more than a few years old (mine is 4) the built in wireless adapter might not be compatible with this unit. I must also add that the Linksys support agents I dealt with were patient, helpful and followed up by calling back to make sure things were working properly.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Immediately had more "bars" on my devices. It was ...
customer_reviews.text: Immediately had more "bars" on my devices. It was time for an upgrade--and this device was highly rated. It replaced an older Linksys. So far--it is working well. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Christelynn

customer_reviews.title: Gives you the range you need!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Linksys fan. I've never had any problems with the multiple routers I've had over the years. I set this one up as a range extender to go along with my EA9500. Very pleased! So far so good, I don't expect any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mc

customer_reviews.title: We are delighted with this Linksys AC2600
customer_reviews.text: We are delighted with this Linksys AC2600. I can't provide technical info like most of the other reviewers. But suffice it to say that in the past we encountered great difficulty and frustration trying to get WiFi access across our very long home even using boosters. This product easily and quickly goes throughout our house without the boosters. We can now access all that we need with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a seamless wifi system that provides multiple wireless access points to provide coverage in our home and finally found it. I bought this and the AC1900 Range extender, they work flawlessly together!!! Plenty of coverage for our two story home while maintaining a single wifi signal, no longer have to switch between wireless routers. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: with Covid - had to work from home and kids doing school from home. Spouse was already working from home. Wifi has been consistently able to handle up to 8 devices - 4 laptops plus phones all at the same time
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Got it up and running pretty straight forward installation , works great I though I would have to use the range extender but it covers the whole house with strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Worst router ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst router I have ever bought. Nothing but problems with this dropping Wi-Fi and slow connect speeds. It will be the last Linksys router I will ever purchase. 3 hours with tech support because they don't want to replace it. Stay away. Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! I have owned it 6-months and never dropped ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I have owned it 6-months and never dropped a WiFi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Could not set up! Got a nighthawk instead, no problems setting up
customer_reviews.author: michael c.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice router!! I like the mimo feature and dual bands!! I have been getting better range and consistency with speed!! Works great and easy to install!! I would recommend this router!!
customer_reviews.author: PAZ

customer_reviews.title: and excellent coverage in my 2100 sq ft brick ranch
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, and excellent coverage in my 2100 sq ft brick ranch. Don't even need a range extender for the basement or outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speed and strong signal everywhere in a 2500-sf house
customer_reviews.text: Great range, covers basement, to ground and second floors, to attic, and everywhere on our 0.2 acre property. Router is on ground floor.
customer_reviews.author: Village Idiot

customer_reviews.title: Sad as it did not extend range any further of my very old Netgear Router
customer_reviews.text: . I purchased this to replace my very old Netgear Router. All the tech hype, multi antennas, beaming BS etc. Not an iota better. Cost a lot though.
customer_reviews.author: Trader M

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time...
customer_reviews.text: This product is not ready for prime time. After messing with it for three days I sent it back. From not keeping it's settings to needing to have on internet access to configure it missed the mark by a long margin. By the way I work for a company that sells wifi products, I am a technical manager and deal with wifi on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Router fails after two years
customer_reviews.text: This router FAILED and died a little more than two years after purchase. I feel like I bought a reconditioned router. I am very angry at Linksys for selling me an inferior product. $150 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: MsE

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year. All of a sudden the main internet port stopped working and Linksys support said there was nothing they could do for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Great router and highly recommended it
customer_reviews.text: The signal strength from this router is amazing. My whole house is covered and part of the yard. Very easy to set up,
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: 2.4g has poor coverage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. 5g has excellent coverage I have this router for a year now without a problem. I bought another one and installed it at the opposite side of the house, now have full coverage.
customer_reviews.author: B.Will

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and great performance. Using in the corner of the second story of our home and receiving great coverage throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: ale

customer_reviews.title: very good power. It reaches the very corners of my ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well, very good power. It reaches the very corners of my 2500 square house. Fairly easy set-up if you download the app. first.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Lange

customer_reviews.title: Great for parental controls
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Had an old Linksys, (several years old), was only getting 7-10 mbps. Now getting 50+. Love the parental controls. The app is ok, could be better. Glad I made the purchase. No more "buffering" while watching rented movies on Vudu.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Dickson

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my old router!
customer_reviews.text: We were always having to wait for videos to load. For years I thought the problem was my cable company. With our Linksys, everything runs so much faster now. Didn't realize what a difference a router could make.
customer_reviews.author: sdb

customer_reviews.title: so I read and reread the setup instructions - was even concerned that it seemed too easy, and there was something I was missing
customer_reviews.text: I have 0 experience installing a router. Doing it without help really worried me, so I read and reread the setup instructions - was even concerned that it seemed too easy, and there was something I was missing. Took me a couple of days to decide to jump right in. I COULD NOT BELIEVE HOW EASY IT WAS! The Linksys interface is very good. It took all of about 15 minutes start to finish. Would have been faster, but I was being very careful. This is the easiest piece of hardware I have installed in a very long time, maybe ever! And now I have solid wireless in the entire house! Thank you Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: S. Weis

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Working as expected very easy to setup, and 5ghz is managing to cover the whole house. Best speed was 300 down 40 up. But only at 40mhz channel bonding instead of 80 due to older system
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: I need to figure out how to return it. ...
customer_reviews.text: I need to figure out how to return it. My devices will only hold connections for a few minutes, 30 minutes tops. Even the wired connections are noticeably slower. Put the old router back in play and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis LaRue

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: Love this router. Needed a new one to expand range and provide better quality wifi. Works great! I'm really glad I bought it. It's easy to setup you can use an app on your phone. We have a large house (~5k sq feet) this is in my basement and on the 2nd floor I still get great signal. Also have a bunch of devices connected, including Xbox one. Streaming movies and playing games is much faster now.
customer_reviews.author: Faheem N

customer_reviews.title: Super quick to find the true problem.
customer_reviews.text: I know little to nothing about a modem or router, so when help came callin' I was totally relieved. Talk about knowledgeable!
customer_reviews.author: Myrnaj 5

product_meta.title: Linksys AC2600 4 x 4 MU-MIMO Dual-Band Gigabit Router with USB 3.0 and eSATA (EA8500)
product_meta.description:
Style:Router OnlyFeaturing the latest in Wireless-AC, the AC2600 Dual Band 4x4 MU-MIMO Router (EA8500) delivers four data streams--instead of the traditional two or three--to all your devices for a seamless entertainment experience. Take your gaming and streaming to the next level with the AC2600 Dual Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router. The AC2600 is equipped with a 1.4 GHz dual-core CPU and features MU-MIMO technology, so it can handle heavy-bandwidth activities and heavy network traffic at a combined speed of up to 2.53 Gbps, making it the ultimate in fast Wi-Fi technology.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Works with Amazon Alexa.IPv6 compatible: Yes
4x4 MU-MIMO (Multi-User MIMO) technology delivers four data streams for a seamless entertainment experience
MU-MIMO handles heavy network traffic and high-bandwidth activities on multiple devices at the same time
Powered by Qualcomm Internet Processor. Radio Frequency Bands: 2.4 & 5GHz.Wireless speeds of up to AC1733 Mbps + N800 Mbps.Networking Options:802.11b,802.11g,802.11n (2.4 GHz only)

Data at speeds up to 2.53 Gbps, six times faster than Wireless-N.Platform Compatibility:Windows XP,Windows Vista 32/64,Windows 7 32/64,Windows 8 32/64,Windows 8.1 32/64,Mac OS X 10.5.8 Leopard,Mac OS X 10.6.1 Snow Leopard,Mac OS X 10.7 Lion,Mac OS X 10.8 Mountain Lion,Mac OS X 10.9 Mavericks,Windows 10 32/64

specifications.Operating System: Windows, Mac OS, Mac, PC, Windows
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars781 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
